result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kerwin A Moore

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kerwin A Moore in court.  Attorney May Y Lee in court for Kerwin A Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Addendum to Plea

Defendant Kerwin A Moore in court with attorney May Y Lee.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kerwin A Moore in court with attorney May Y Lee.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and a potential dpaoffer.
State confirms penidng tad evaulation results. Court ordered matter adjourned
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kerwin A Moore in court with attorney .  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference 
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney May Lee to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $45.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 30Days after the conclusion of the case.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment. Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel. . 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Kerwin A Moore
Current: 10429 W Kiehnau Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53222   (Effective: 05-23-2022)
Prior: 7000 West Thurston Court, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Kerwin A Moore in court.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Kerwin A Moore not in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/04/2022@2:00pm
